properties.name: row
properties.description: an object containing all values for this row

properties.name: column
properties.description: an object containing the column configuration for the cell being rendered

methods.name: renderValue
methods.description: renders the content if this cell

attributes.name: row
attributes.description: an object containing all values for this row

attributes.name: column
attributes.description: an object containing the column configuration for the cell being rendered

properties.name: columns
properties.description: contains all available columns from the actindo-grid

properties.name: _columns
properties.description: internal structure for keeping the columns

methods.name: openColumnConfiguration
methods.description: opens the dialog which allows the user to select the visible columns and sort them

methods.name: _onColumnsChanged
methods.description: called when the columns array changes. Reflects the changes to the internal column list

methods.name: _toggleVisibility
methods.description: called when a user taps a visibility checkbox for a column. Toggles the columns visibility

attributes.name: columns
attributes.description: contains all available columns from the actindo-grid

methods.name: _onButtonTap
methods.description: called when the user taps the search button

methods.name: _onQueryChanged
methods.description: called when the query changes. Let userInput follow this new value

methods.name: _onSearch
methods.description: called when the user wishes to search for the current query

methods.name: _onSearchBlur
methods.description: called when the serch input is blurred

elements.description:
`<actindo-grid>` implements a highly reusable data grid to display your data.

### Features

- column configuration as property, therefore dynamic column changes are propagated through data binding
- global search bar (hidden if no column is configured to be `searchable`)
- filter panel (hidden if no column is configured to be `filterable`)
- sorting (by every column that is configured to be `sortable`)
- pagination as long as a `remote` is specified to fetch data from
- remote loading of data, including sorting, paging, searching, filtering
- static data display (disables pagination)
- custom cell formatting through `render` callbacks
- hidden columns that can be shown manually

properties.name: columnConfiguration
properties.type: [{label: string, field: string, type: mixed, identifying: bool, hidden: bool, searchable: bool, sortable: bool, filterable: bool, resizable: bool, render: function}]
properties.description:
contains the columns and their configuration.
* label: the name of this column, used in the header
* field: data index where this columns value is located
* type: the data type of this column, can be any valid javascript type
* identifying: if this column contains a unique key that identifies the single rows. _One_ column must have this if you want to use a selection mode
* hidden: if this column is hidden by default and needs to be enabled manually
* searchable: if this field is searched through the global search field. Defaults to false
* sortable: if the grid can by sorted by this field. Defaults to false
* filterable: if the grid can be filtered by this columns values
* resizable: if this column is resizable
* render: Optional callback that is given the columns value for each row and has to return a DOMElement to be displayed

properties.name: disabledField
properties.description: if an item has a key with this name and contains a value that evaluates to true, that row is disabled

properties.name: finishedField
properties.description:
if an item has a key with this name and contains a value that evaluates to true, that row is marked as finished.
This only works with a selection mode enabled since the marker replaces the checkbox

properties.name: page
properties.description: the current page number

properties.name: sort
properties.description:
contains the current sorting criteria, the key "field" contains the field name, the field "order" a boolean: true is ASC, false is DESC
{field: String, order: Boolean}

properties.name: query
properties.description: contains the current search query

properties.name: totalItems
properties.description: stores the number of total items (over all pages)

properties.name: hideColumnConfiguration
properties.description: if this is true, the column selection switch is hidden and the user can not enable/disable or rearrange columns

properties.name: items
properties.description:
contains all items that are currently in the grid. You can set this property to manually
handle the content of the grid in case you don't want to use the remote loading

properties.name: itemsPerPage
properties.description: how mny items to show per page

properties.name: lockedField
properties.description: if an item has a key with this name and contains a value that evaluates to true, that row is marked as locked.

properties.name: remote
properties.description:
the url to load items from. Alternatively you can use the property `items` to manually add data to the grid,
however that disables the possibility to search, filter, or sort

properties.name: remotePathData
properties.description: where the items array is located in the remote response.

properties.name: remotePathCount
properties.description: where the total count of items is located in the remote response.

properties.name: remoteParams
properties.description: additional url params to be added to the remote url

properties.name: remoteParamFilter
properties.description: this url param is added to the `remote` url containing the user selected filters

properties.name: remoteParamLimit
properties.description: this url param is added to the `remote` url containing the number of items to be loaded

properties.name: remoteParamOffset
properties.description: this url param is added to the `remote` url containing the requested page

properties.name: remoteParamSearch
properties.description: this url param is added to the `remote` url containing the search phrase the user entered

properties.name: remoteParamSearchFields
properties.description: this url param is added to the `remote` url containing the fields that should be searched for `query`

properties.name: remoteParamSort
properties.description:
this url parameter is added to the `remote` url containing the user selected sorting. Set this
to null to sort the data locally

properties.name: selectionMode
properties.description:
how rows can be selected. "multi" to allow the selection of n elements, "single" to allow the
selection of only a single element (selecting a new one will deselect the previously selected one).
Any other value will disable the selection model entirely.
If a selection mode is enabled, a checkbox is added to the start of each row

properties.name: selectedItem
properties.description: if selectionMode=single, this property contains the selected item if one is selected

properties.name: selectedItems
properties.description: contains all the currently selected items

properties.name: disableTapRowToSelect
properties.description:
if this is enabled and a selection mode is active, tapping a row will not select it. Rows can then
only be selected by explicitely checking their checkboxes

properties.name: _columns
properties.description: internal property that holds the processed columns

properties.name: _identifyingColumn
properties.description: holds the colmumn that is marked as identifying

properties.name: _everythingSelected
properties.description: property that controls the checked state of the "select all checkbox" in selectionMode=multi

properties.name: _partiallySelected
properties.description: property that indicates if a partial selection is active (at least one item, but not all)

methods.name: firstPage
methods.description: loads the first page

methods.name: lastPage
methods.description: loads the last page

methods.name: nextPage
methods.description: loads the next page

methods.name: previousPage
methods.description: loads the previous page

methods.name: refresh
methods.description: reloads the grid data from the remote

methods.name: _initColumnResizing
methods.description: sets up the column resizing handlers

methods.name: _onHeadTapped
methods.description: called when the table head is tapped. Check if the tapped column is sortable and if so, sort by it

methods.name: _onQueryChanged
methods.description: called when the property `query` changes. Set page to 1

methods.name: _onRowTap
methods.description:
called when a row in the table is tapped. If row tapping should select the row and a selection mode
is active, the tapped row is selected

methods.name: onSelectedItemChanged
methods.description: called when the selected item changes (selection mode = single). Updates the selectedItems property

methods.name: _toggleAllSelection
methods.description: called when the "select all" checkbox is tapped. Toggles the selection of all items

methods.name: _onItemsChanged
methods.description:
called when the items property changes. Move it to _items and make sure to properly
propagate the change.
Unfortunately a copy of th original item has to be created to make polymer aware of this change.

methods.name: _onPageChanged
methods.description: called when a new page is set. Make sure it's within the possible bounds

methods.name: _onSelectionChanged
methods.description: called when the selected items change. Fires an event

methods.name: _consolidateColumns
methods.description:
called when the columnConfiguration changes. Process the columns and copy them to the internal
_columns property.

methods.name: _onRemoteChanged
methods.description: called on explicit refresh or if any of the parameter changes that require a reload from the remote

methods.name: _serialize
methods.description:
takes the given object and creates an http query string from it
usage: let str = _serialize({foo: 'bar', baz: ['a', 'b']}); => 'foo=bar&baz[0]=a&baz[1]=b'

params.name: prefix
params.description: internal only (used in recursive calls for nested objects)

methods.name: _sizeColumnsByHeaders
methods.description:
sets the width of all grid cells to the width of its headers. This is sometimes required, for example when adding
new rows: without setting an explicit width they are autosized and may end up blowing up the width of the entire column

methods.name: _canPageBackward
methods.description: checks if the user can page backwards

methods.name: _canPageForward
methods.description: checks if the user can page forwards

params.name: itemsPerPage
params.description: how many items per page should be shown

params.name: totalItems
params.description: how mnay items are in the grid in total

methods.name: _getItemsFrom
methods.description: calculates the offset for the pagination query

params.name: page
params.description: the page to calculate the offset for

params.name: itemsPerPage
params.description: how many items per page should be shown

methods.name: _getItemsTo
methods.description: returns the index of the last item on the given page

params.name: page
params.description: the pag to calculate the last index for

params.name: itemsPerPage
params.description: how many items per page should be shown

methods.name: _evaluatesTrue
methods.description: checks if the given value evaluates to true

methods.name: _isColumnVisibile
methods.description: determines if the given column is visible

methods.name: _isItemSelected
methods.description: checks if the given item is selected

params.name: item
params.description: one item from the current data array

params.name: selectedItems
params.description: an array of currently selected items

methods.name: _isSortedBy
methods.description: checks if the grid is currently sorted by the given column

methods.name: _propertyEvaluatesTrue
methods.description: determines if the given field evaluates to true in the given item.

methods.name: _stringEquals
methods.description:
checks if the given string equals one or more given strings. The first given parameter is the value to
look for, it is compared with oll other given params and if one of them matches, true is returned; otherwise
false

methods.name: _getColumnWidth
methods.description: helper to determine the width of newly rendered cells

return.desc: a css string defining the width

elements.name: ActindoGrid

attributes.name: column-configuration
attributes.description:
contains the columns and their configuration.
* label: the name of this column, used in the header
* field: data index where this columns value is located
* type: the data type of this column, can be any valid javascript type
* identifying: if this column contains a unique key that identifies the single rows. _One_ column must have this if you want to use a selection mode
* hidden: if this column is hidden by default and needs to be enabled manually
* searchable: if this field is searched through the global search field. Defaults to false
* sortable: if the grid can by sorted by this field. Defaults to false
* filterable: if the grid can be filtered by this columns values
* resizable: if this column is resizable
* render: Optional callback that is given the columns value for each row and has to return a DOMElement to be displayed
